item.title: Report E-2023080930
item.description:
Report E-2023080930

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3378 Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate release from a 50-pound paper bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-pounds of product released impacting a 4' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 2' x 2' area of the concrete dock floor due to improper unloading. The damaged bag and all released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080762
item.description:
Report X-2023080762

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brough to QA wet. An employee started filing a DPR and repacking the contents for delivery, then felt her hands burning and other areas of her body where she touched herself. DescribePack: The original package was discarded before the employee knew she was working with a hazmat material. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We applied gloves and cleaned up where contents were wet on public surfaces.
